meanings.definition: A delivery of supplies or equipment by parachute.
meanings.sent1: During the military exercise, the soldiers received an airdrop of food and water.
meanings.sent2: The airdrop of medical supplies was crucial in reaching the remote village.
meanings.sent3: The airdrop of party favors at the birthday celebration surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The airdrop of confetti created a colorful spectacle at the event.
meanings.sent5: The airdrop of leaflets spread important information to the citizens below.

meanings.definition: To deliver supplies or equipment by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The humanitarian organization decided to airdrop aid to the disaster-stricken area.
meanings.sent2: The military planned to airdrop reinforcements to the troops on the ground.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly suggested we airdrop snacks to our friends from the balcony.
meanings.sent4: The skydivers airdropped gracefully, landing perfectly on target.
meanings.sent5: The pilot skillfully airdropped the supplies despite challenging weather conditions.

meanings.definition: To drop or release something from an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot had to airdrop the cargo due to engine failure.
meanings.sent2: The crew decided to airdrop the emergency supplies to the stranded hikers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids wanted to airdrop water balloons on their friends below.
meanings.sent4: The storm caused the plane to airdrop its excess fuel before attempting to land.
meanings.sent5: The movie scene required the stuntman to airdrop from the helicopter onto the building.
